text: The LNER Class R1/I1 4-8-2 was a proposed class of British 4-8-2 type Steam Locomotive that was going to be built in 1939 designed by Sir Nigel Gresley but was cancelled due to the plans of the locomotive too big to go around curves pulling ether goods trains or passenger trains. The Locomotive would have been classified as a Class R1 or a Class I1 a 4-8-2 version of the GNR/LNER Class A1 and A3 4-6-2 type locomotives the same class LNER Class A3 4472 Flying Scotsman was designed .
title: LNER 4-8-2
